page.title: 04TRANSPORT BLEASBY/THURGARTON
page.content: The{A612 Nottingham,Southwell Road} runs in a steady arc roughly north to south across the block.It swings about laterally to no apparent pattern.This is made worse by the light rolling nature of the stream crossed land, especially to the north.The road,with its many ascending and descending blind bends, is totally unsuitable for today's through traffic.{Thurgarton} is a good example of a place spoiled by the internal combustion engine.The minor roads are no better:at{Goverton} the road into{Bleasby}has a right angle bend with a difficult camber and is on a hillside of course! The{Nottingham-Newark-Lincoln {Railway}runs straight S.W./N.E.across the block with stations at the top of {Bleasby}and,less fortunately,a good 1/4 mile out on the{Hoveringham}road at{Thurgarton.
